label: 狩衣
本: The Clear Mirror:  A Chronicle of Japanese Court During the Kamakura Period, (1185-1333) . Stanford University Press . 1998
説明文: So called because it was originally worn for hunting. Made of fine fabrics and used as everyday wear by  the nobility. The neck was usually round, and the sleeves and skirt were often split to allow for voluminous under-clothing.
